chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michele T. Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety to include no purchasing, possession, or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to the physician's orders. 

No contact with R.K.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Supervised based on DOC Evaluations.

Court obligations and DOC Supervision fees to be paid.

DNA sample.

Assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment programs as deemed appropriate by COMPAS Assessment and agent including SAFE program.  

Defendant would not be eligible for SAP and ERP programming. 

Probation Review Hearing 9/8/2017 @ 1:15pm

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called: 10:01 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Anne Renc.
Parties have received their PSI copies. No changes are to be made to the PSI.
Court has received a Victim Impact Statement. 
State makes sentencing arguments.
Defense makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes statement.
COURT addresses the Defendant.
COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 2 (2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety-Domestic Abuse)>> Sentence W/H- 4 Years Probation. CONDITIONS: Supervised based on DOC Evaluations, Restitution to be paid within 6 Months, Court Oligations and DOC Supervision Fees to be paid including Court Costs including DNA Surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge, DNA Sample. Absolute Sobriety to include no purchasing, possession, or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to the physician's orders, No Contact with R.K., Maintain Full time Employment, Assessments, Evaluations and/or treatment programs as deemed appropriate by COMPAS Assessment and agent including SAFE Program. I/S 6 Months MCJ for rule violations. Court finds 4 Days Credit. Defendant would not be eligible for SAP and ERP Programming.

DATES: Probation Review Hearing 9/8/2017 @ 1:15 pm

PSI REPORTS TO BE SEALED.

Adjourned: 10:33 am
Copy sent to the attorneys 6/14

Shall not consume alcohol.
